page.title: 09THE RED CROSS & NURSING HOME
page.content: A Red Cross day centre is held in Buckingham from 09:00 to 16:30. It caters for mainly 70-75-year-old pensioners. Paid and voluntary staff provide meals,washing and hairdressing facilities;while visiting bands provide entertainment,for a daily price of 1.40 {THE NURSING HOME One of the residents was interviewed by pupils,who obtained the following information: The Home is warden-controlled,and if the residents want anything they have only to ask him. There are no gardens, but window-boxes are allowed. There is a long waiting list for people wishing to enter the Home. At the moment there are three people who cannot walk,and two other disabled people living there. Trips are organised for the people's leisure.
